intro: Senecio cumingii, commonly known as the Cuming's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, seed-bearing structures. Senecio cumingii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
